3002.definition: [Λεββαῖος] of uncertain origin; Lebbæus, a Christian

3003.definition: [λεγεών] of Latin origin; a "legion", i.e. Roman regiment (figuratively)

3004.definition: [λέγω] a primary verb; properly, to "lay" forth, i.e. (figuratively) relate (in words (usually of systematic or set discourse; whereas {{G2036}} and {{G5346}} generally refer to an individual expression or speech respectively; while {{G4483}} is properly to break silence merely, and {{G2980}} means an extended or random harangue)); by implication, to mean

3006.definition: [λεῖος] apparently a primary word; smooth, i.e. "level"

3007.definition: [λείπω] a primary verb; to leave, i.e. (intransitively or passively) to fail or be absent

3008.definition: [λειτουργέω] from {{G3011}}; to be a public servant, i.e. (by analogy) to perform religious or charitable functions (worship, obey, relieve)

3009.definition: [λειτουργία] from {{G3008}}; public function (as priest ("liturgy") or almsgiver)

3010.definition: [λειτουργικός] from the same as {{G3008}}; functional publicly ("liturgic"); i.e. beneficient

3011.definition: [λειτουργός] from a derivative of {{G2992}} and {{G2041}}; a public servant, i.e. a functionary in the Temple or Gospel, or (genitive case) a worshipper (of God) or benefactor (of man)

3012.definition: [λέντιον] of Latin origin; a "linen" cloth, i.e. apron

3014.definition: [λέπρα] from the same as {{G3013}}; scaliness, i.e. "leprosy"

3015.definition: [λεπρός] from the same as {{G3014}}; scaly, i.e. leprous (a leper)

3016.definition: [λεπτόν] neuter of a derivative of the same as {{G3013}}; something scaled (light), i.e. a small coin

3017.definition: [Λευΐ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3878}}); Levi, the name of three Israelites Compare {{G3018}}.

3018.definition: [Λευΐς] a form of {{G3017}}; Lewis (i.e. Levi), a Christian

3019.definition: [Λευΐτης] from {{G3017}}; a Levite, i.e. descendant of Levi

3020.definition: [Λευϊτικός] from {{G3019}}; Levitic, i.e. relating to the Levites

3025.definition: [ληνός] apparently a primary word; a trough, i.e. wine-vat

3026.definition: [λῆρος] apparently a primary word; twaddle, i.e. an incredible story

3030.definition: [λίβανος] of foreign origin ({{H3828}}); the incense-tree, i.e. (by implication) incense itself

3031.definition: [λιβανωτός] from {{G3030}}; frankincense, i.e. (by extension) a censer for burning it

3032.definition: [Λιβερτῖνος] of Latin origin; a Roman freedman

3033.definition: [Λιβύη] probably from {{G3047}}; Libye, a region of Africa

3035.definition: [λίθινος] from {{G3037}}; stony, i.e. made of stone

3036.definition: [λιθοβολέω] from a compound of {{G3037}} and {{G906}}; to throw stones, i.e. lapidate

3037.definition: [λίθος] apparently a primary word; a stone (literally or figuratively)

3038.definition: [λιθόστρωτος] from {{G3037}} and a derivative of {{G4766}}; stone-strewed, i.e. a tessellated mosaic on which the Roman tribunal was placed

3039.definition: [λικμάω] from λικμός, the equivalent of λίκνον (a winnowing fan or basket); to winnow, i.e. (by analogy), to triturate

3040.definition: [λιμήν] apparently a primary word; a harbor Compare {{G2568}}.

3041.definition: [λίμνη] probably from {{G3040}} (through the idea of nearness of shore); a pond (large or small)

3042.definition: [λιμός] probably from {{G3007}} (through the idea of destitution); a scarcity of food

3043.definition: [λίνον] probably a primary word; flax, i.e. (by implication) "linen"

3046.definition: [λίτρα] of Latin origin (libra); a pound in weight

3047.definition: [λίψ] probably from λείβω (to pour a "libation"); the south(- west) wind (as bringing rain, i.e. (by extension) the south quarter)

3048.definition: [λογία] from {{G3056}} (in the commercial sense); a contribution

3049.definition: [λογίζομαι] middle voice from {{G3056}}; to take an inventory, i.e. estimate (literally or figuratively)

3054.definition: [λογομαχέω] from a compound of {{G3056}} and {{G3164}}; to be disputatious (on trifles)

3055.definition: [λογομαχία] from the same as {{G3054}}; disputation about trifles ("logomachy")

3056.definition: [λόγος] from {{G3004}}; something said (including the thought); by implication, a topic (subject of discourse), also reasoning (the mental faculty) or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, (with the article in John) the Divine Expression (i.e. Christ)

3060.definition: [λοίδορος] from λοιδός (mischief); abusive, i.e. a blackguard

3061.definition: [λοιμός] of uncertain affinity; a plague (literally, the disease, or figuratively, a pest)

3062.definition: [λοιποί] masculine plural of a derivative of {{G3007}}; remaining ones

3063.definition: [λοιπόν] neuter singular of the same as {{G3062}}; something remaining (adverbially)

3064.definition: [λοιποῦ] genitive case singular of the same as {{G3062}}; remaining time

3065.definition: [Λουκᾶς] contracted from Latin ; Lucas, a Christian

3066.definition: [Λούκιος] of Latin origin; illuminative; Lucius, a Christian

3068.definition: [λούω] a primary verb; to bathe (the whole person; whereas {{G3538}} means to wet a part only, and {{G4150}} to wash, cleanse garments exclusively)

3069.definition: [Λύδδα] of Hebrew origin ({{H3850}}); Lydda (i.e. Lod), a place in Palestine

3070.definition: [Λυδία] properly, feminine of Ludios (of foreign origin) (a Lydian, in Asia Minor); Lydia, a Christian woman

3071.definition: [Λυκαονία] perhaps remotely from {{G3074}}; Lycaonia, a region of Asia Minor

3072.definition: [Λυκαονιστί] adverb from a derivative of {{G3071}}; Lycaonistically, i.e. in the language of the Lycaonians

3073.definition: [Λυκία] probably remotely from {{G3074}}; Lycia, a province of Asia Minor

3074.definition: [λύκος] perhaps akin to the base of {{G3022}} (from the whitish hair); a wolf

3075.definition: [λυμαίνομαι] middle voice from a probably derivative of {{G3089}} (meaning filth); properly, to soil, i.e. (figuratively) insult (maltreat)

3076.definition: [λυπέω] from {{G3077}}; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad

3078.definition: [Λυσανίας] from {{G3080}} and ἀνία (trouble); grief-dispelling; Lysanias, a governor of Abilene

3079.definition: [Λυσίας] of uncertain affinity; Lysias, a Roman

3081.definition: [λυσιτελεῖ] third person singular present indicative active of a derivative of a compound of {{G3080}} and {{G5056}}; impersonally, it answers the purpose, i.e. is advantageous

3082.definition: [Λύστρα] of uncertain origin; Lystra, a place in Asia Minor

3083.definition: [λύτρον] from {{G3089}}; something to loosen with, i.e. a redemption price (figuratively, atonement)

3088.definition: [λύχνος] from the base of {{G3022}}; a portable lamp or other illuminator (literally or figuratively)

3089.definition: [λύω] a primary verb; to "loosen" (literally or figuratively) Compare {{G4486}}.

3090.definition: [Λωΐς] of uncertain origin; Lois, a Christian woman

3091.definition: [Λώτ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3876}}); Lot, a patriarch

3092.definition: [Μαάθ] probably of Hebrew origin; Maath, an Israelite

3093.definition: [Μαγδαλά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{H4026}}); the tower; Magdala (i.e. Migdala), a place in Palestine

3094.definition: [Μαγδαληνή] feminine of a derivative of {{G3093}}; a female Magdalene, i.e. inhabitant of Magdala

3097.definition: [μάγος] of foreign origin ({{H7248}}); a Magian, i.e. Oriental scientist; by implication, a magician

3098.definition: [Μαγώγ] of Hebrew origin ({{H4031}}); Magog, a foreign nation, i.e. (figuratively) an Antichristian party

3099.definition: [Μαδιάν] of Hebrew origin ({{H4080}}); Madian (i.e. Midian), a region of Arabia

3100.definition: [μαθητεύω] from {{G3101}}; intransitively, to become a pupil; transitively, to disciple, i.e. enrol as scholar
